alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 13 at 9:18AM AKDT until May 16 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKDT MONDAY NIGHT FOR DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR EASTERN ALASKA RANGE... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning for dry and windy conditions, which is in effect from noon Sunday to midnight AKDT Monday night. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Eastern Alaska Range, including Isabel Pass. * TIMING...10 AM Sunday to 12 AM Monday night. * WINDS...South 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid to upper 50s. * IMPACTS...Rapid Ignition, growth and spread of fires are possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
